question: What is "Karz-e-Hasna?" Husband's sister gave money to my father-in-law and said, it was Karz-e-Hasna.
answer:
QUESTION
Respected Mufti Sahib, 1) Before I married my husband, my husband's sister gave some money to my father-in-law to assist them with a personal issue. She said it was Karz-e-Hasna? What is Karz-e-Hasna? 2) Whenever she has an agrument with my father-in-law or my husband or they do not agree with her on something, she orders them that they MUST pay back the money to her? They are not in the position to pay her back at this time? This situation is causing alot of stress. Please guide us. Jazakallah Khair.
ANSWER


Share:
Qardh-e-Hasana literally means a good loan. It generallly refers to making
charitable contributions with the intention of gaining the reward in the
hereafter. It is also used as an interest free loan. According to the
details of your question, since your sister-in-law claims repayment of the
loan from her father, it appears that she gave them an interest free loan.

Was salaam

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT
